description: Borrowed from Yiddish כּשרן‎ (kashern), from כּשר‎ (kosher, “kosher”).

verbs.description: kasher (third-person singular simple present kashers, present participle kashering, simple past and past participle kashered)

entries.meaning: (of meat) to remove excess blood from by washing and salting
examples: “Kosher salt” is called thus, not because it is any more kosher than other types of salt, but because it is used in the kashering process of meat.

entries.meaning: (of kitchenware) to remove traces of non-kosher substances from by cleaning, heating, etc.
examples: David moved into his new apartment, put up mezuzahs, and kashered his new kitchen.
